Cloud-native is an approach of building and running applications based on cloud computing delivery model. Microservices is an approach of thinking and designing systems based on small, independent, and loosely coupled services.

Cloud-native microservices is about creating applications built with services packaged in containers, through agile DevOps and continuous delivery pipelines, managed on elastic cloud computing infrastructure.

Cloud-native microservices are distributed systems capable of continuous improvement, on-demand scaling, and fault tolerance, that are ready to be deployed on public, private, and hybrid clouds.
